answers.answer: Hi There,you need more information.The most common situation is a urinary tract infection.Other issues can arise that are unrelated to cancer but are related to medical conditions such as diabetes or high blood pressure that can put a stress on the kidneys.Finally , certain chemotherapy drugs can cause reduced kidney function such as cisplatin.Protein in the urine is not a sign that the cancer has returned.Please let us know how things are goingbest wishes

question: My mother has been in remission for Ovarian Cancer for 2 years.  At her last checkup they found protein in her urine.  I know that could mean different things.  She has to go back for another urine test  How worried should I be?
title: Ptotein in Urine
